themes: Negative impact of funding restructure on arts organizations
Loss of artistic community and talent in Austin
Critique of funding priorities focused on 'communities experiencing the threat of erasure'
key_phrases: After the previous restructure, my arts organization has no longer been awarded any funding
The feedback is utterly inconsistent from the panels
I devoted countless hours for nothing
The funding restructure quite literally gutted the cultural ecosystem
There must be some way to restore some funding to artists
The prescribed pursuit of serving exclusively communities experiencing 'the threat of erasure' is wholly limiting
It might be better to listen to the community instead of hiring out-of-town consultant
barriers_identified: Loss of funding due to restructure
Decisions made by out-of-town consultants lacking local knowledge
solutions_proposed: Restore some funding to artists whose missions are to make performance
Listen to the community instead of hiring out-of-town consultants
